text: why haven't you signed a letter to
Donald Trump condemning his decision to
pull out of the Paris climate change
agreement something which simply which
the presidents of Germany and France and
Italy have done yes and I haven't
because I actually have spoken to Donald
Trump and told him that the UK believes
in the Paris agreement and that we
didn't want the United States to leave
the Paris agreement the g7 leaders sat
round the table last week and spoke to
untold Donald Trump that the six of us
told him that we've believed the Paris
agreement was an important international
agreement on climate change that we
wanted the United States to stay in it I
spoken to him I spoke to him last night
about this what if he's Canada and Japan
haven't signed the letter either what'd
he say
What did he say he says he's taken the
decision because he thinks it's in the
best interest of America I say that the
Paris agreement actually is important
for us globally in terms of dealing with
climate change that's why the UK
supported it and it's why the UK is
continuing you're negotiating you're
negotiating our departure from the EU
wouldn't it have been sensible and
prudent to go along with France and
Germany and Italy and sign a letter to
Donald Trump instead if it being
released that you just said you were
disappointed by his decision it's not a
question of whether or not we should go
along with somebody else David we take
independent decisions as the UK I spoke
to Donald Trump I've told him my views
from the UK's position last week I told
him last night what our views are we
remain committed to the Paris agreement
we continue to think it's important for
dealing with climate change
internationally
